definition: Imperial College (or Academy), the highest educational body in imperial China

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Bianliang Imperial College is a special branch in the central engraving institutions of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在宋代中央刻书机构中，汴梁国子监可谓是一枝独秀。

sentences.english: To deepen understanding of this street, you should know Guozijian and Confucius Temple first.
sentences.chinese: 所以，要了解这条街，就得先知道国子监和孔庙。

sentences.english: The main part of the thesis is divided into five chapters.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要论述唐代国子监学官的学术素养。

sentences.english: Many institutions in the Imperial Academy in Ytlan Dynasty deeply affected the development of that in Ming and Qing period.
sentences.chinese: 其中的许多制度深刻地影响了明清国子监的发展。

sentences.english: The article expounds the development of the Imperial Academy in Ytlan Dynasty from two different angles.
sentences.chinese: 本文从纵横两个角度论述了元代国子监的发展。

sentences.english: The Bianliang Imperial Academy engraving books were mostly engraved and printed in Bianliang.
sentences.chinese: 汴梁国子监刻书大多是在汴梁雕版并印刷的。

definition: Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
Imperial Hanlin Academy, lasting from Tang dynasty until 1911
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
refers to academics employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards, forming the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院
metropolitan civil service examination (held triennially in spring in imperial times)/Crown Prince's chambers/by extension, the Crown Prince
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
